channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown round about, 20th May
item.description:
This roundabout has become overgrown due to the weather we have had recently. This is making it very difficult to anticipate traffic, especially at peak times. While I do appreciate the colours of spring, I feel it is becoming a damage to road users.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3-4 unavoidable potholes, 20th May
item.description:
There are 3-4 large potholes that are becoming unavoidable due tho their growing size and position in the road. They are on the near side of the road when driving away from the main road (deeper into the cul-de-sac) Because of the parking of residents and the curvature of the road, they are now impossible to miss. Each time this road is ‘patched up’ - it is just that, only patched up and not repaired. There are stones that flick up and damage the cars as well as the ever returning pot holes. This entire road needs to be completely relayed- which hasn’t happened in the 10+ years I have lived here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Winton Close, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights have been off for about 3 weeks, 20th May
item.description:
The street lights behind and surrounding my house have been out for approx 3 weeks. I am a young woman who regularly comes home after dark and due to the alley ways and grassy green across the way, it’s very nerve racking to be arriving home and going to the house from the car in the dark. It also makes parking/ turning around very difficult.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winton Close, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car obstructing turning into Manor Park. It's been there for over a month., 20th May
item.description:
Turning into Manor Park on the left hand side. The position makes it difficult to see if there is any oncoming traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chargrove Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Lights turning red when there is no need, 20th May
item.description:
Traffic light number 31 turns red when no pedestrians are present. leaving gloucester road onto whittington road should only turn red when there is a pedestrian. the bus lane has its own set of lights a little further to allow cars joining gloucester road from whittington road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Excessively long grass and weeds,, 20th May
item.description:
Excessively long grass and weeds, limiting visibility, in a busy parking area. It is near the School, so a particular problem for school-children drop-off &pick-up. Others have reported to Tewkesbury BC, and been informed that Glos CC Highways now has grass-cutting responsibility for this area. Could you confirm this, and when it is likely to be cut. Concerned residents can then be informed. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Gretton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds growing up through pavement, 20th May
item.description:
There is a section of pavement outside our house where the pavement is raising and breaking up with weeds quite rapidly pushing up through. I have used some weedkiller but the weeds just come up further along the pavement through another crack. It's making the pavement quite uneven and is getting worse day by day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Rosebay Gardens, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Traffic Chaos, 20th May
item.description:
There are road works on the A435, north and south of the Hyde Lane junction. There are roadworks on the Stoke Orchard road, New Road from Woodmancote to Southam is closed. Kayte Lane, Two Hedges Road and others are grid lock. Where is the Highways planning & coorcindation ? GCC need to get a grip of this appalling situation before drivers frustration leads to a serious accident. I shall watch this report with interest to see if anything is done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kayte Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
